alert.note: Alert for Valley (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 21 at 7:49PM MDT until April 25 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Milk River at Glasgow affecting Valley County. For the Milk River...including Glasgow...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Milk River at Glasgow. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 29.5 feet, Livestock/feedlots adjacent to Milk River become isolated by flood water. Livestock relocation to higher ground should have started. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 29.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM MDT Friday was 30.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Monday evening and continue falling to 16.8 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.1 feet on 03/20/1996. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday evening by 800 PM MDT.
